channel.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
channel.description:
Name change 2.0: [img]http://i62.tinypic.com/1ovr6f.png[/img] Well, my software rasterizer is starting to become a game so I made this thread :) Please note that this program uses only the standard JRE libraries.
[b][u]DOWNLOAD THE DEMO:[/u][/b] http://www.mediafire.com/download/nleul28qgrjnnnd/ShardMasterDemo.jar.zip [b][u]Controls[/u][/b] [b]W[/b],[b]S[/b],[b]A[/b],[b]D[/b] - Move player [b]Arrow Keys[/b] - Rotate camera (left/right, up/down) [b]T[/b],[b]G[/b] - Move camera up and down
[img]http://i59.tinypic.com/2a0ncl5.png[/img]
Features:
Tile based Gouraud shading on textured and solid triangles Custom font image loading 3rd person AND 1st person camera
[img]http://i61.tinypic.com/33ogy2x.png[/img]
[font=verdana]NEWEST VIDEO: [/font][youtube]N4PpvJ_eVvU[/youtube]

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Taharok:

Memory usage in Java can be a strange thing. What are you using to find the memory usage? It might not be giving you the information you think it is. For example, my instance of eclipse that is currently open thinks the current heap size is 133M, with 269M allocated by the VM and a max heap of 455M. Task manager is reporting it is using 506M of virtual memory right now. There’s a big discrepancy between what the VM reports usage and what is actually being used, not to mention the allocated heap memory of the VM does not include allocated heap memory of the JVM process, which is different. You may need to either use native functions to get an accurate memory consumption or use a third party tool.

[font=verdana][size=small]memoryUsage = (r.totalMemory() - r.freeMemory()) >> 10;[/size][/font]

“r” being Runtime.getRuntime()

Read full topic

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Memory usage in Java can be a strange thing. What are you using to find the memory usage? It might not be giving you the information you think it is. For example, my instance of eclipse that is currently open thinks the current heap size is 133M, with 269M allocated by the VM and a max heap of 455M. Task manager is reporting it is using 506M of virtual memory right now. There’s a big discrepancy between what the VM reports usage and what is actually being used, not to mention the allocated heap memory of the VM does not include allocated heap memory of the JVM process, which is different. You may need to either use native functions to get an accurate memory consumption or use a third party tool.

Read full topic

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:47, topic:551757”]RAM goes from 40 MB to 17 MB and then back up to 40 MB again. Also avoid using JOptionPane (I think it’s what it’s called) To choose between High and Low Quality, as it tends to hide itself if you change window and it doesn’t get it’s own icon on the task bar.

And yes, the low res version uses more RAM.[/quote]
Hm thank you for the detailed feedback. The JOptionPane is not going to be in the final program, I’ll be making my own gui to handle settings like that in the future, but thanks for informing me of that task bar thing, I didn’t know about that.

Man I’m stumped as to why low res uses more memory. I’m loading 32x32 textures rather than 128x128 textures which means that there are int[] arrays that are four times smaller than high res…

Lmao I forgot to resize the water and wood textures to 32x32 in the low quality folder

Read full topic

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

RAM goes from 40 MB to 17 MB and then back up to 40 MB again. Also avoid using JOptionPane (I think it’s what it’s called) To choose between High and Low Quality, as it tends to hide itself if you change window and it doesn’t get it’s own icon on the task bar.

And yes, the low res version uses more RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:45, topic:551757”][quote author=Limits link=topic=670672.msg4488688#msg4488688 date=1435976328]

not sure if intended?

Are you referring to the player? Because the texture is scaled down and reinterpolated at 4x its size, the darker parts of the texture show through, which is what you see there.
[/quote]Weird. I updated the news thread about this with a line about the demo being available now.
edit: lots of ram usage spikes too[/quote]
It’s weird how the game runs at 35-42 mb on your computer but only around 17k on mine. I’ve been working on controlling the memory usage for some time now, it appears I still have more to do lol. Thanks for the support

Read full topic

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Download the new demo!

MediaFire

ShardMasterDemo.jar.zip

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.


Controls
W,S,A,D - Move player
Arrow Keys - Rotate camera (left/right, up/down)
T,G - Move camera up and down

Tell me how the game feels, there’s no content lol

Read full topic

Began work on the ugliest game frame on the planet.

20hu1hh.png810×629

Also added more game-engine-like qualities such as graphics settings. You can now choose to load high quality textures or low quality textures.

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“veer, post:27, topic:551757”][quote author=Limits link=topic=670672.msg4485425#msg4485425 date=1433719508]

just checked; he has a shitty basic renamed version of an RS2 beta client and it’s not relevant

Oh well 3D clipping is just done by using the parametric equation of a line and by using planes i just CBA to implement it because it isnt easy to implement.

? that seems irrelevant. RSC uses a simple triangle clipping algorithm (‘splitting’ polygons when intersections occur) but nobody afaik has bothered to figure out how it works.

:palm: lol, you just proved that you dont know what you are talking about. Also, that clipping algorithm is not a jagex secret, it’s how you do 3D clipping if your engine only supports triangles.
[/quote]

lmao[/quote]
Sorry mate, misunderstood your question. No hard feelings?

Read full topic

item.title: [Now w/Demo] Shard Master 3D
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Taharok:

Did you ever end up implementing clipping?

No, I used another, far easier method, of checking whether or not all of the vertices of each triangle were within the screen’s bounds.
